reviewText: This game is incredibly original and all adventure game lovers will surely appreciate it.\nThe story is touching and bittersweet, and the gameplay is very well orchestrated.\nBackgrounds, characters and animations are completely hand drawn and they are very consistent with the overall atmosphere.

reviewText: A quirky and interesting game. A nice experience for people who enjoy old school point-and-click adventure games. The artwork in the game is fully hand drawn and is insanely impressive. Definitely check this one out!

reviewText: An atmospheric little point and click adventure with an original protagonist to say the least.  Like most adventure games of this type it is devilishly tricky.\n\nFeels like a (silent) David Lynch movie crossed with Fallout, minus the ultraviolence. It has an innocent charm, but a sinister undercurrent, so I'm not yet sure if I should let my kids play it.

Great White North Studios

Projector face so far is a nice break from multi play and fps types of games.

The game itself is like a silent movie and you have to figure stuff out using that big brain of yours to make your way through the different scenes.

The main character art and environments are well done along with overal theme. This one is safe for the kids!

Enjoy the Brain Teezers!!

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nThis game has a quirky sense of style and flair.   While I did get it to review for free, I definitely enjoyed it.  And I think it's a great example of doing something rather unique with the hidden object genre games.   The one aspect that people might notice are the sticky animations.   I was told this was from the rather limited budget this game was created with.   For what they had, I think they did a very good job indeed.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nVery fun game. I really liked the art style and the story was entertaining. I'll probably play it again sometime.

Very interesting concept and aesthetic, especially with the design of Projector Man! Not super original though, since it immediately reminded me of Saga of course.

The biggest thing I would critique is how long it takes to find items or complete an objective. The most frustrating part is that nothing stands out or is highlighted, so you have to click on everything you see until something happens. I almost lost interest several times. Also, the objectives aren't laid out, so sometimes it's confusing as to what you have to do.

A suggestion may be to add more dialogue and hints when you click items, instead of having him just shrug and shake his head. Just like they would in Silent Hilll or something.

Overalll the game itself if interesting enough to grab my attention but if it takes me too long to find an object I'm going to quit out of frustration.

I lost my marbles at the A Trip to the Moon" reference. (:"
